alert.note: Alert for Alamance (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 7:56PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Durham, Forsyth, Guilford and Orange. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain overspreading the Triad. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, Durham, High Point, Chapel Hill, Burlington, Graham, Hillsborough, Kernersville, Carrboro, Clemmons, Mebane, Elon, McLeansville, Rougemont, Lewisville, Summerfield, Gibsonville and Stokesdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
